H0.text: Nursing is a learned characteristic of a newborn horse.

H1.text: Walking is a learned characteristic of a newborn horse.

H2.text: Sleeping is a learned characteristic of a newborn horse.

H3.text: Breathing is a learned characteristic of a newborn horse.

A4.text: Healthy foals can typically keep up with the rest of the herd only a few hours after birth.

A5.text: A foal can stand and run shortly after birth.

A6.text: Horses are able to sleep both standing up and lying down, with younger horses tending to sleep significantly more than adults.
